alert.note: Alert for Iredell; Rowan (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 20 at 3:16PM EDT until June 20 at 9:15PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southern Iredell County in the piedmont of North Carolina... Southwestern Rowan County in the piedmont of North Carolina... * Until 915 PM EDT. * At 316 PM EDT, Training cells are developing over southern Rowan and Iredell counties resulting in significant runoff and rapid stream rises. 1-3 inches of rain has fallen over the past 1-2 hours with additional rainfall expected as cells continue to move across the area. This is on top of 2-5 inches of rain that fell from thunderstorms last night. This rainfall will produce significant flooding impacting roads and structures. Seek higher ground now and avoid all flooded roadways. Stay away from all streams. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... Kannapolis, Salisbury, Statesville, Mooresville, Davidson, China Grove, Landis, Enochville, Troutman, Cleveland, Lake Norman State Park, Mount Ulla, Piedmont Research Station and Doolie. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life.
